reasoning: OCA1A accounts for approximately 50% of OCA cases globally. Prevalence estimated at 1 in 40,000 (12-25 per 100k) depending on population ancestry. Type 1 has better prognosis than type 2. Incidence from newborn screening programs estimated at ~1.5 per 100k births.
source: Okulicz-Kozaryn R et al. Prevalence of albinism in Poland. Am J Med Genet. 2003; Gronskov K et al. Birth prevalence of albinism in Denmark. Orphanet J Rare Dis. 2007
